trans-unit.source: How to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your application to use Twitter login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your application to use Twitter login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure Mobile Apps to use Twitter as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure Mobile Apps to use Twitter as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Twitter account that has a verified email address.
trans-unit.target: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Twitter account that has a verified email address.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Twitter account, go to twitter.com.
trans-unit.target: To create a new Twitter account, go to twitter.com.

trans-unit.source: Register your application with Twitter
trans-unit.target: Register your application with Twitter

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your Twitter app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your Twitter app.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, **User authentication**, and then click **Twitter**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, **User authentication**, and then click **Twitter**.

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Callback URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Callback URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your Twitter app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your Twitter app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the [Twitter Developers] website, sign-in with your Twitter account credentials, and click **Create New App**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the [Twitter Developers] website, sign-in with your Twitter account credentials, and click **Create New App**.

trans-unit.source: Type in the **Name** and a **Description** for your new app.
trans-unit.target: Type in the **Name** and a **Description** for your new app.

trans-unit.source: Paste in your **Mobile App URL** for the **Website** value.
trans-unit.target: Paste in your **Mobile App URL** for the **Website** value.

trans-unit.source: Then, for the **Callback URL**, paste the **Callback URL** you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: Then, for the **Callback URL**, paste the **Callback URL** you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: This is your Mobile App gateway appended with the path, _/signin-twitter_.
trans-unit.target: This is your Mobile App gateway appended with the path, _/signin-twitter_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-twitter`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-twitter`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom the page, read and accept the terms.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom the page, read and accept the terms.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Create your Twitter application**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Create your Twitter application**.

trans-unit.source: This registers the app displays the application details.
trans-unit.target: This registers the app displays the application details.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Settings** tab, check **Allow this application to be used to sign in with Twitter**, then click **Update Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Settings** tab, check **Allow this application to be used to sign in with Twitter**, then click **Update Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the values of **Consumer Key (API Key)** and **Consumer secret (API Secret)**.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the values of **Consumer Key (API Key)** and **Consumer secret (API Secret)**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The consumer secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The consumer secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.

trans-unit.source: Add Twitter information to your Mobile App
trans-unit.target: Add Twitter information to your Mobile App

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure Management Portal] on the Twitter setting blade for your Mobile App, paste in the API Key and API Secret values which you obtained previously.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure Management Portal] on the Twitter setting blade for your Mobile App, paste in the API Key and API Secret values which you obtained previously.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Twitter for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Twitter for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Related Content
trans-unit.target: Related Content

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
